@@ -0,0 +1,75 @@
+package tests
+
+object ImplementationSuite extends BaseSlowSuite("implementation") {
+
+  check(
+    "basic",
+    """|package a
+       |trait Livin@@gBeing
+       |abstract class <<Animal>> extends LivingBeing
+       |class <<Dog>> extends Animal
+       |class <<Cat>> extends Animal
+       |""".stripMargin
+  )
+
+  check(
+    "advanced",
+    """|package a
+       |trait Livin@@gBeing
+       |trait <<MadeOfAtoms>> extends LivingBeing
+       |abstract class <<Animal>> extends LivingBeing
+       |class <<Dog>> extends Animal with MadeOfAtoms
+       |class <<Cat>> extends Animal
+       |""".stripMargin
+  )
+
+  check(
+    "nested",
+    """|package a
+       |trait LivingBeing
+       |abstract class Ani@@mal extends LivingBeing
+       |object outer{
+       |  object inner{  
+       |    class <<Dog>> extends Animal
+       |    class <<Cat>> extends Animal
+       |    class Unrelated extends LivingBeing
+       |  }
+       |}
+       |""".stripMargin
+  )
+
+  // TODO needs scalameta update
+  // check(

comments.body:
I would prefer to keep the multiline string syntax for declaring a file layout
```scala
"""|
   |/src/main/scala/a/LivingBeing.scala
   |object foo
   |/src/main/scala/a/Bar.scala
   |object bar
   |""".stripMargin
```

The large number of `"""`, `->`, commas and other syntax makes it harder to read and evolve the file structure.
